channel.title: BBC News - UK

item.title: Costa del Sol: Man and children drowned 'in tragic accident'
item.description: Three members of the same family were found in a Costa del Sol swimming pool on Christmas Eve.

item.title: Gavin and Stacey top Christmas Day TV ratings
item.description: The much-anticipated reunion show is a festive smash hit, the most-watched Christmas show in 11 years.

item.title: British troops move black rhinos to Malawi
item.description: The animals were moved from a South Africa park in the hope they would be protected from poachers.

item.title: Demand for BBC Action Line advice doubles in 2019
item.description: There was a rise in the number of people seeking advice about sexual abuse and mental health after BBC shows.

item.title: Rowan Williams: Climate change 'largest challenge ever'
item.description: Dr Rowan Williams says some people don't believe in the climate crisis as it is hard to face up to.

item.title: Tortoise rescued after setting Great Dunmow house on fire
item.description: The "angry-looking" reptile was home alone when it knocked over a heat lamp, starting a fire.

item.title: Jelly Green uses art sales to protect Brazilian rainforest
item.description: Jelly Green, 27, says she wanted to act after seeing the "deeply alarming" effects of deforestation.

item.title: Second man charged over fatal stabbings in Barnet and Elstree
item.description: The two male victims were found within five miles of each other on 19 and 20 December.

item.title: Cliff-fall dog, Shadow, recovered after Eype beach ordeal
item.description: Shadow was found emaciated and with a broken leg after spending weeks trapped on a Dorset beach.

item.title: Channel migrants: Coastguard lead search and rescue operation
item.description: Two aircraft and Border Force vessels are scrambled to a "number of incidents," the coastguard says.

item.title: Travel: Family to sell their home to live on the road in Europe
item.description: Jennifer, Ollie and their son Charlie are going to live in a van as they travel across Europe.

item.title: Books 2020: What you could be reading
item.description: Titles to look forward to - from David Mitchell and Hilary Mantel to new writers and celebrities.

item.title: My Money: 'I'm exactly Â£1,000 lighter'
item.description: As part of a new BBC blog series, Angela Jansen shares what she spent her money on this week.

item.title: Watkin's Wembley folly: London's 'Eiffel Tower' that never was
item.description: A Victorian rail magnate tried to build a taller tower than Eiffel's - but it did not go to plan.

item.title: Loneliness: How one shed is bringing people together
item.description: A retired teacher has transformed the building into a Men's Shed, helping to tackle loneliness.

item.title: Christmas Day with a difference across England
item.description: Spare a thought for those sea swimming, feeding the lonely and even giving birth on Christmas Day.

item.title: Why I spend my weekends ringing birds
item.description: More than a million birds are trapped every year in the British Isles by volunteers.

item.title: Call the Midwife: The real-life nurses who inspired Scottish adventure
item.description: The nuns swap Poplar for the Outer Hebrides in a Christmas special inspired by real "Hebridean Heroines".

item.title: Communities in Calderdale 'traumatised' by 2015 floods
item.description: Hundreds of people affected by severe flooding four years ago have sought mental health support.

item.title: 'Why it's OK I'm not seeing my family this Christmas'
item.description: 'All the adverts are families happy in a house together. That's not what a family is these days.'

item.title: Christmas shopping online or in person - who wins?
item.description: Online shopping is on the rise, with more and more people choosing the sofa to buy goods, but which is better?

item.title: Morpurgo's Christmas (fire) cracker
item.description: A behind-the-scenes look at the making of the yuletide offering from children's author, Sir Michael Morpurgo.

item.title: Dog walker helps men talk about mental health
item.description: Rob Osman started the group Dudes And Dogs when he realised dog walking had pulled him out of depression.

item.title: The Queen's Christmas message 2019: In full
item.description: The monarch says "small steps" and not giant leaps bring about the most lasting change.

item.title: Prince George and Princess Charlotte join Christmas Day church service
item.description: The Royal Family greet well-wishers after attending the Christmas Day church service at Sandringham.

item.title: James Corden on Gavin and Stacey return
item.description: James Corden on being back in Barry Island and why he decided it was time for a Gavin and Stacey reunion.

item.title: The Papers: Queen's 'two Christmases' and bridge hero awards
item.description: The Boxing Day papers cover the Royals' Christmas and possible honours for London Bridge survivors.

item.title: Murder investigation after Christmas Eve shooting
item.description: A man believed to be in his 30s was pronounced dead at the scene by emergency services.

item.title: Glencoe fire: Ski resort closed after base station 'almost completely' destroyed
item.description: Glencoe Mountain Resort says the base station restaurant was "almost completely" destroyed.

item.title: Kinnaird Close, Belfast: Man, 35, appears in court over double murder
item.description: Frances Murray and Joseph Dutton were found dead in a flat in Kinnaird Close on Monday.

item.title: Man killed in Christmas Day crash near Neath
item.description: Emergency services were called to a crash involving two cars and a pedestrian near Neath.

item.title: Sewage warning for Witney stream after heavy rainfall
item.description: Thames Water says some wastewater is allowed to overflow to prevent flooding to homes.
